title: Triad of Isis, Horus and Nephthys
description:
Pale green glazed faience amulet representing the triad of, from left to right, Isis, Horus as a child and Nephthys. The three stride upon a flat plinth with high back slab. Isis and Nephthys hold Horus’ hands; they wear striated lappet wigs, and their emblems (throne and “ht” sign supporting a “neb” basket) upon their heads. The figures are well modelled with large breasts and pronounced navels. 
Condition: Glaze stained light brown over much of surface; glaze pitted around figures; otherwise good.

museum_location.name: This item is not on view
